steps.step: Pulse all rmoulade ingredients in a food processor until combined, then transfer to a bowl.
Preheat oven to 350F with rack in middle.
Stir together parsley, horseradish, mustard, garlic, and zest. Gradually stir in panko, then drizzle with 1/3 cup olive oil and gently stir.
Pat fish dry and arrange, skin side down, on a large platter.
Brush flesh with 1 tablespoon oil, then season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Gently pat about 1/2 cup panko mixture evenly onto each fillet.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot, then saut fillets in 2 batches, crumb side down first, carefully turning once with a large spatula, until golden on both sides, about 6 minutes total per batch.
Transfer to a large shallow baking pan. (Fish will not be fully cooked.) Wipe skillet clean and add remaining tablespoon oil for second batch.
Bake fish in oven until just cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Serve with rmoulade.
Cooks' note:Rmoulade can be made 1 day ahead and chilled, covered. Bring to room temperature before serving.

ingredients.name: hot sauce
ingredients.original: 1/4 teaspoon hot sauce such as Tabasco
ingredients.originalString: 1/4 teaspoon hot sauce such as Tabasco

ingredients.name: olive oil
ingredients.original: 1/3 cup plus 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided
ingredients.originalString: 1/3 cup plus 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided

ingredients.name: whitefish fillets
ingredients.original: 4 (8-oz) whitefish fillets (about 3/4 inch thick), pin bones removed
ingredients.originalString: 4 (8-oz) whitefish fillets (about 3/4 inch thick), pin bones removed

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.

Heat a large braising pot over medium-high heat. Season the beef with salt and pepper. Sear the beef, browning it on both sides, about 5 minutes a side. Carefully add the stock and enough water to just cover the meat.
Add the onion, celery, and bay leaf. Bring the liquid to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer, cover, and cook for 1 hour.

Add the carrots and potatoes and cook until the meat is tender, about another hour. Carefully lift out the meat, place on a cutting board, and cover with foil. Strain the vegetables from the stock. Discard the celery, onion, and bay leaf. Arrange the carrots and potatoes on a platter and cover with foil to keep warm. Continue cooking the stock uncovered over medium heat until reduced by half, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, slice the meat against the grain, on an angle. Arrange the meat alongside the carrots and potatoes on the platter. When the stock has reduced, season with salt and pepper, to taste, and transfer to a gravy dish.
Serve the Bollito Misto with the gravy and bowls of the Gorgonzola Sauce and the Salsa Verde.
Put all the ingredients in a food processor and combine until smooth.
Serve in a side dish.
In a bowl, stir all the ingredients together until combined.
Serve in a side dish.

ingredients.name: carrots
ingredients.original: 4 carrots, peeled and cut into thirds
ingredients.originalString: 4 carrots, peeled and cut into thirds
ingredients.originalName: carrots, peeled and cut into thirds

ingredients.name: hot sauce
ingredients.original: 2 teaspoons hot sauce, or 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes
ingredients.originalString: 2 teaspoons hot sauce, or 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes
ingredients.originalName: hot sauce, or 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes

ingredients.name: parsley leaves
ingredients.original: 1 cup chopped parsley leaves, about 1 bunch
ingredients.originalString: 1 cup chopped parsley leaves, about 1 bunch

ingredients.name: top round steak
ingredients.original: 4 pounds beef brisket or top round
ingredients.originalString: 4 pounds beef brisket or top round

ingredients.name: water
ingredients.original: About 4 cups water, enough to cover the beef
ingredients.originalString: About 4 cups water, enough to cover the beef
ingredients.originalName: About water, enough to cover the beef

ingredients.original: 4 carrots, peeled and cut into thirds
